en: What is the difference between imitation and real diamonds?
zh: 仿钻和真钻有什么区别？

en: Beware of imitations.
zh: 小心假货。

en: Hypocrisy is my abhorrence.
zh: 我最讨厌虚伪了。

en: Hypocrisy is the homage that vice pays to virtue.
zh: 虚伪是恶行向美德表达的敬意。

en: I don't need fake friends.
zh: 我不需要虚伪的朋友。

en: Experience without learning is better than learning without experience.
zh: 有经验没学识，也比有学识没经验强。

en: When the cat is away, the mice will play.
zh: 猫不在，老鼠就翻天了。

en: Even the hard-hearted can be moved to tears.
zh: 铁石心肠的人也会感动落泪。

en: Fortune is the rod of the weak, and the staff of the brave.
zh: 命运是弱者的鞭子，是勇者的手杖。

en: There's no telling what kind of trouble this proposal might stir up. The result is certainly going to be something to see.
zh: 谁也不知道这个提议会惹出什么乱子，结果肯定有的瞧了。

en: In the days of the knights, they wore shields to protect themselves from sword-fight wounds.
zh: 在骑士时代，他们戴着盾牌保护自己免受剑伤。

en: The prospect of famine hangs over many areas of the world.
zh: 饥荒的阴影笼罩着世界上很多地区。

en: Because of the famine, the cattle starved to death.
zh: 因为饥荒，牲口都饿死了。

en: Disease and famine go together.
zh: 疾病和饥荒总是相伴而生。

en: Can you share food with others in the face of famine?
zh: 面对饥荒，你还能跟别人分享食物吗？

en: Famine caused great distress among the people.
zh: 饥荒给人们带来了巨大的痛苦。

en: I might as well drown as starve.
zh: 我与其饿死，倒不如淹死。

en: Hunger knows no law.
zh: 人在饥饿面前是顾不得法律的。

en: Hunger is one of the strongest griefs.
zh: 饥饿是最深重的痛苦之一。

en: Hunger impelled him to crime.
zh: 饥饿驱使他走上了犯罪道路。

en: We can say that Japan was fighting a constant battle against hunger during the war.
zh: 可以说，在战争期间，日本一直在与饥饿作斗争。

en: It is sad that so few people give money to help the hungry.
zh: 很少有人捐钱救济饥民，真让人难过。

en: Shine on my brilliant soul.
zh: 照亮我辉煌的灵魂。

en: I gasped with surprise at the horrible picture of the starving people.
zh: 看到那些饥民惨状的照片，我惊讶得倒吸了一口凉气。

en: All that glitters is not gold.
zh: 发光的不一定都是金子。

en: It was a bright and clear Sunday morning.
zh: 那是一个晴朗明媚的周日早晨。

en: You should be alert to the possible dangers.
zh: 你应该警惕潜在的危险。

en: You need not have woken me up.
zh: 你本来不必叫醒我的。

en: Time to get up.
zh: 该起床了。

en: It is too early to get up.
zh: 现在起床还太早。

en: Do get up, it's very late.
zh: 快点起床，已经很晚了。

en: Get up!
zh: 起来！

en: What is done cannot be undone.
zh: 木已成舟，无法挽回了。

en: Go to the hospital.
zh: 去医院吧。

en: You are beautiful.
zh: 你真漂亮。

en: You are her daughters.
zh: 你们是她的女儿。

en: You are teachers.
zh: 你们是老师。

en: You are human.
zh: 你是人类。

en: You are actresses.
zh: 你们是女演员。

en: You like rain, don't you?
zh: 你喜欢下雨，对吧？

en: You are the only one.
zh: 你是唯一的一个。

en: You are doctors.
zh: 你们是医生。

en: I'll always love you, no matter what happens.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都会永远爱你。

en: Didn't you hear her speaking French?
zh: 你没听到她在说法语吗？

en: You are much too kind to me.
zh: 你对我太好了。

en: Do you know how to use a personal computer?
zh: 你会用电脑吗？

en: You lent a book.
zh: 你借出了一本书。

en: You'll go to school tomorrow.
zh: 你明天要去学校。

en: You have a telephone.
zh: 你有电话。

en: You go to the Chikushi river.
zh: 你去筑后川。

en: You are my best friend.
zh: 你是我最好的朋友。

en: You like Kawaguchi.
zh: 你喜欢川口。

en: You like elephants.
zh: 你喜欢大象。

en: You have three cars.
zh: 你有三辆车。

en: Do you study chemistry?
zh: 你学化学吗？

en: You drink tea.
zh: 你喝茶。

en: You study English.
zh: 你学英语。

en: You are a doctor.
zh: 你是个医生。

en: You like balls.
zh: 你喜欢球类运动。

en: You are a tennis player.
zh: 你是个网球运动员。

en: We'll leave as soon as you are ready.
zh: 你准备好了我们就出发。

en: Let us know when you'll arrive.
zh: 你到了后跟我们说一声。

en: Put your affairs in order.
zh: 把你的事情处理好。

en: What's your shoe size?
zh: 你穿多大码的鞋？

en: Your shoes want mending.
zh: 你的鞋该修修了。

en: I've been anxious to meet you.
zh: 我一直很想见你。

en: What's your home address?
zh: 你家地址是什么？

en: I have some appreciation of your problems.
zh: 我挺能理解你的难处的。

en: She rushed to the office, and was ushered right into an examination room.
zh: 她匆忙赶到诊所，直接被领进了检查室。

en: She was very shy about her emergency problem, and asked the gynecologist to please examine her.
zh: 她对自己的急症感到很害羞，请妇科医生帮她检查一下。

en: Your tap water is too hard. Get a water softener.
zh: 你们家的自来水太硬了，装个软水机吧。

en: You have tennis elbow. Soak your arm in warm water.
zh: 你得了网球肘，把胳膊在温水里泡泡。

en: Your daughter's on drugs.
zh: 你女儿在吸毒。

en: Your dog has worms. Give him vitamins.
zh: 你的狗肚子里有虫，给它吃点维生素。

en: Thank you again for your kind assistance.
zh: 再次感谢您的热心帮助。

en: You have been a great mentor to me.
zh: 您一直是我的良师益友。

en: He was created a peer.
zh: 他被封为贵族。

en: I'd like to check some of my valuables.
zh: 我想寄存一些贵重物品。

en: Will you keep my valuables for me, please?
zh: 能请您帮我保管一下贵重物品吗？

en: Could you hold these valuables?
zh: 能帮我拿一下这些贵重物品吗？

en: Can I deposit valuables here?
zh: 这里可以寄存贵重物品吗？

en: A valuable object decreases in value if it is damaged.
zh: 贵重物品如果损坏了就会贬值。

en: Put your valuables in the safe.
zh: 把贵重物品放进保险箱里。

en: The valuables are in the safekeeping of the bank.
zh: 贵重物品都存在银行里。

en: You should keep your valuables in a safe place.
zh: 你应该把贵重物品放在安全的地方。

en: She kept her valuables in the bank for safety.
zh: 为了安全，她把贵重物品存在了银行。

en: Please check your valuables at the front desk.
zh: 请把贵重物品寄存在前台。

en: That'll make for a memorable time.
zh: 那会是一段令人难忘的时光。

en: Can you spare me a few minutes of your valuable time?
zh: 能耽误您几分钟时间吗？

en: Would you please send me details of your products via e-mail as an attachment?
zh: 能请您把产品的详细资料作为附件发邮件给我吗？

en: I'm very impressed with your quality control.
zh: 你们的质量控制给我留下了很深的印象。

en: We would like to distribute your product in Japan.
zh: 我们想在日本经销你们的产品。

en: If the quality of your product meets with our customer's approval, we will place regular orders.
zh: 如果你们的产品质量能让我们的客户满意，我们会定期订货。

en: What is the percentage of overseas markets for your products?
zh: 你们产品的海外市场份额是多少？

en: I'd like some information about your new computers.
zh: 我想了解一下你们新款电脑的信息。

en: I learned about your portable copier at the Tokyo-Office '97 Expo.
zh: 我是在 97 年东京办公设备展上了解到你们的便携式复印机的。

en: It was a great pleasure for me to meet many associates of your company.
zh: 很高兴能见到贵公司的这么多同仁。

en: Please tell me the closest station to your office.
zh: 请告诉我离你们办公室最近的车站。

en: Your technical manager arranged a meeting for 1:00 p.m. on April 6, but how about April 7, at 10:00 a.m.?
zh: 你们的技术经理安排在 4 月 6 日下午 1 点见面，改成 4 月 7 日上午 10 点行吗？

en: Please indicate what action you will take.
zh: 请说明你们将采取什么行动。

en: Please change your database to reflect the new address as follows.
zh: 请按下列信息更新数据库里的地址。

en: We are afraid that our new address is not registered on your database.
zh: 恐怕我们的新地址还没在你们数据库里登记。

en: We are interested in your service.
zh: 我们对你们的服务挺感兴趣的。

en: We have considered your proposal, and we have decided that we are not able to reduce the price.
zh: 我们考虑了你的提议，最后决定还是没法降价。

en: In reply to your request, we offer you an extra discount of 5% on this order.
zh: 针对你的要求，这单我们给你额外打个九五折。

en: We have given your order highest priority.
zh: 我们已经优先处理你的订单了。

en: I would appreciate it if you could reserve a room at a convenient location for visiting your office.
zh: 要是能帮我在去你们公司方便的地方订个房，那就太感谢了。

en: We appreciate the opportunity you've given us to learn more about your organization.
zh: 感谢你给我们机会了解你们公司。

en: We would like to ask your help in clearing up our financial problems with your company.
zh: 我想请你帮个忙，把我们和你们公司之间的账目问题清一下。

en: I would like to come and see you.
zh: 我想过去见见你。

en: Any orders you place with us will be processed promptly.
zh: 只要你下单，我们立马就处理。

en: Please inform us as to what quantity you can deliver at regular intervals.
zh: 请告诉我们你定期能供货的数量。

en: Here is our answer to your fax message dated April 1st.
zh: 这是对你4月1号那份传真的回复。

en: We believe that you will be able to make a price concession.
zh: 我们相信你应该能在价格上让个步。

en: Please do not touch the record side.
zh: 请不要碰唱片的那一面。

en: Records certify that Bob passed his driving test.
zh: 记录证明鲍勃通过了驾照考试。

en: The monument was set up in the park.
zh: 公园里建了一个纪念碑。

en: On top of the statue, Sadako is holding a golden crane over her head.
zh: 在雕像顶上，佐佐木祯子头顶举着一只金色的纸鹤。

en: The commemorative ceremony ended with the closing address.
zh: 纪念仪式在闭幕词中结束了。

en: The press besieged the minister with questions.
zh: 媒体把部长围起来问个不停。

en: Reporters do not hesitate to intrude into people's privacy.
zh: 记者们为了挖隐私可是一点都不带犹豫的。

en: During the press conference, the President touched on foreign relations.
zh: 记者会上，总统提到了外交关系。

en: The reporter shot questions at the politician.
zh: 记者连珠炮似地向那位政客提问。

en: The reporter took down everything that was said.
zh: 记者把说的话全都记下来了。

en: The journalist was too upset to distinguish vice from virtue.
zh: 那个记者太激动了，连是非黑白都分不清了。

en: The reporter covered the gas explosion in Shibuya.
zh: 记者报道了涩谷的煤气爆炸事件。

en: The reporter criticized the politician.
zh: 记者批评了那个政客。

en: The reporter refused to name his sources.
zh: 记者拒绝透露消息来源。

en: She cried bitterly at a press interview.
zh: 她在接受采访时哭得很伤心。

en: The press is interested in his private life.
zh: 媒体对他私生活挺感兴趣的。

en: A reporter is interviewing Dr. Patterson about Koko, a talking gorilla.
zh: 记者正就那只会说话的大猩猩可可采访帕特森博士。

en: Reporter: Can you give me an example?
zh: 记者：能举个例子吗？

en: How did she tell them?
zh: 她是怎么跟他们说的？

en: Did she hurt that kitten?
zh: 她伤到那只小猫了吗？

en: Reporter: Did you buy her a kitten?
zh: 记者：你给她买小猫了吗？

en: I read about All Ball.
zh: 我读过关于All Ball的事情。

en: Most people think that gorillas are stupid. Is that true?
zh: 大多数人都觉得大猩猩挺笨的，是真的吗？

en: The article's tone was one of pessimism.
zh: 这篇文章的基调挺悲观的。

en: The length of the article is not to exceed 1000 words.
zh: 文章字数不能超过1000字。

en: She has a good memory, too.
zh: 她的记性也不错。

en: My memory is failing.
zh: 我记性越来越差了。

en: A good memory is his weapon.
zh: 记性好就是他的杀手锏。

en: It is still fresh in my memory.
zh: 那件事我还记忆犹新。

en: People who regularly work in the open air do not suffer from sleeplessness.
zh: 经常在户外干活的人不会失眠。

en: Regular exercise is beneficial to good health.
zh: 经常运动对身体有好处。

en: I believe in exercising regularly.
zh: 我觉得应该坚持规律运动。

en: You should practice playing the piano regularly.
zh: 你应该坚持练钢琴。

en: An orderly lifestyle and a regular diet are the keys to health.
zh: 作息规律、饮食定时是健康的关键。

en: Those who violate the rules will be punished.
zh: 违反规定的人会受罚。

en: Anyone breaking the rules will be asked to leave on the spot.
zh: 谁要是坏了规矩，当场就得走人。

en: All of the rules must be in line with company policy.
zh: 所有的规定都必须符合公司的政策。

en: The rules must be few, and what is more important, simple.
zh: 规定得少，而且更重要的是得简单。

en: The rules must be few, and more importantly, simple.
zh: 规定要少，更重要的是要简单。

en: Rules are to be observed.
zh: 规矩得守。

en: We must observe the rules.
zh: 我们得遵守规矩。

en: Technically he is still a student.
zh: 严格来说，他还是个学生。

en: We punished him according to the rules.
zh: 我们按照规定惩罚了他。

en: You must follow the regulations.
zh: 你得遵守规定。

en: Don't go against the rules.
zh: 别违反规矩。

en: You must not violate the regulations.
zh: 千万别违反规定。

en: A fussy referee can ruin a bout.
zh: 爱挑刺的裁判能毁了一场比赛。

en: The rule requires that theses be written in English.
zh: 规定要求论文必须用英文写。

en: The rules require us all to be present.
zh: 规定要求我们都得到场。

en: Gas is a little cheaper with self-service, now that deregulation is kicking in.
zh: 现在管制放开了，自助加油会便宜一点。

en: Noriko really is a nice person, isn't she?
zh: 典子人真的很好，不是吗？

en: In 776 B.C., the first Olympic Games were held at the foot of Mount Olympus to honor the Greeks' chief god, Zeus.
zh: 公元前776年，为了纪念希腊主神宙斯，第一届奥运会在奥林匹斯山脚下举行。

en: By the year 2020, the population of our city will have doubled.
zh: 到2020年，我们城市的人口将翻一番。

en: We can clearly see the cycle of the seasons in Canada.
zh: 在加拿大，可以清楚地看到四季的轮回。

en: Just keep your fingers crossed.
zh: 祈祷好运吧。

en: A whistle blew, and the boat slowly began to pull out of port.
zh: 汽笛一响，船就慢慢驶出了港口。

en: The steamer is now out of sight.
zh: 已经看不见那艘轮船了。

en: A steamship is, without doubt, a city in itself.
zh: 毫无疑问，一艘轮船本身就像是一座城市。

en: Which goes faster, a ship or a train?
zh: 船和火车哪个跑得快？

en: Reading kills time on a train trip.
zh: 坐火车时看书挺打发时间的。

en: The train was brought to a sudden halt.
zh: 火车突然停了下来。

en: The train was delayed because of heavy snowfall.
zh: 因为大雪，火车晚点了。

en: The train was held up for two hours on account of the snowstorm.
zh: 因为暴风雪，火车耽误了两个小时。

en: The train was not so crowded as I had expected.
zh: 火车上没我想象的那么挤。

en: The train was so crowded that I was kept standing all the way.
zh: 火车上人太多了，我一路都是站着的。

en: The train will arrive on time without fail.
zh: 火车肯定会准时到的。

en: The train hasn't arrived yet.
zh: 火车还没到。

en: The train left the station and was soon lost in sight.
zh: 火车驶离了车站，很快就看不见了。

en: The train has not arrived yet.
zh: 火车还没到呢。

en: The train is ready to start.
zh: 火车准备好出发了。

en: The train was about to leave the station.
zh: 火车正要发车。

en: Trains come more often than buses.
zh: 火车班次比汽车多。

en: The train traversed a tunnel.
zh: 火车穿过了一个隧道。

en: The train was due at six.
zh: 火车本该六点到。

en: The trains leave at two-hour intervals.
zh: 火车每隔两小时发一班。

en: I had my purse and commutation ticket stolen while I was sleeping on the train.
zh: 我在火车上睡觉时，钱包和月票被偷了。

en: We were roused at daybreak by the whistle of a train.
zh: 天刚亮我们就给火车的汽笛声吵醒了。

en: Beware lest you should miss the train.
zh: 留神点，别误了火车。

en: Hurry up in order to catch the train.
zh: 快点，好赶上火车。

en: I got there in time for the train.
zh: 我及时赶到了，没误火车。

en: The train was delayed, so I could not arrive there on time.
zh: 火车晚点了，所以我没能准时到那儿。

en: We should take into account that the train was delayed.
zh: 我们得考虑到火车晚点的情况。

en: The train was derailed.
zh: 火车脱轨了。

en: They waved good-bye to their parents as the train pulled out.
zh: 火车开动时，他们挥手跟父母道别。

en: As the train was crowded, I kept standing all the way to Kyoto.
zh: 因为火车太挤，我一路站到了京都。

en: If your windows are not airtight, moisture will seep in.
zh: 如果窗户不严实，湿气就会渗进来。

en: Our train stopped suddenly.
zh: 我们的火车突然停了。

en: Why don't we drive out to the country for a change of pace?
zh: 我们要不开车去郊外转转，换个心情？

en: Let's take a walk for a change.
zh: 咱们去散散步，换换心情吧。

en: Mother advised me to take a walk for a change.
zh: 我妈劝我出去走走，换个心情。

en: Let's eat out for a change.
zh: 咱们出去吃吧，换换口味。

en: Let's take a break for a change.
zh: 咱们歇会儿，换换脑子。

en: I wish you would take me to a restaurant for a change.
zh: 我真希望你能带我去外面餐厅吃，换换样。

en: Are you feeling sick?
zh: 你不舒服吗？

en: Are you feeling OK?
zh: 你还好吗？

en: If you need a change of pace, why don't you come for a visit?
zh: 要是你想换个心情，干嘛不过来玩玩？

en: We are having a whale of a time.
zh: 我们玩得可开心了。

en: How do you feel now?
zh: 你现在感觉怎么样？

en: When he feels fine, he goes for a walk.
zh: 他身体好的时候会去散散步。

en: When I feel fine, I go for a walk.
zh: 我感觉不错的时候会去散散步。

en: Not feeling well, I stayed home all day.
zh: 因为不太舒服，我在家待了一整天。

en: I'm not feeling well.
zh: 我不太舒服。

en: I can't see you today because I feel ill.
zh: 我今天见不了你，因为我感觉不舒服。

en: I'm not up for it.
zh: 我没那个心情。

en: I felt ill and was admitted to the hospital, but in the event, it was nothing serious.
zh: 我当时觉得不舒服住了院，结果其实没什么大碍。

en: Sick and tired, she went to bed early.
zh: 她又累又不舒服，早早就睡了。

en: Not feeling well, I stayed home on that day.
zh: 那天我不舒服，就待在家里了。

en: Do you feel sick?
zh: 你觉得难受吗？

en: Because she felt sick.
zh: 因为她觉得不舒服。

en: I don't feel well. Could you give me some medicine?
zh: 我不太舒服，能给我点药吗？

en: Not being well, she stayed home.
zh: 她身体不舒服，就待在家里了。

en: I'm feeling ill, but I intend to go out anyhow.
zh: 我感觉不舒服，但还是打算出去。

en: I'm feeling fine now.
zh: 我现在感觉好多了。

en: I'm feeling low.
zh: 我现在心情挺低落的。

en: I feel refreshed.
zh: 我觉得神清气爽。

en: It is easy to get the cranky man's goat by teasing him.
zh: 逗那个脾气古怪的人很容易让他发火。

en: You have to be patient.
zh: 你得有耐心。

en: The generous dentist contributed some two billion yen to charity.
zh: 那位慷慨的牙医给慈善机构捐了大约二十亿日元。

en: I think I'm going to faint.
zh: 我觉得我快要晕倒了。

en: He gives me the creeps.
zh: 他让我感觉毛毛的。

en: The weather bureau says it will rain tonight.
zh: 气象局说今晚会下雨。

en: I don't like girls who put on airs.
zh: 我不喜欢爱摆架子的女生。

en: Try and calm down.
zh: 尽量冷静点。

en: Everybody loved the simple scholar.
zh: 大家都喜欢那个朴实的学者。

en: Don't change your mind.
zh: 别改变主意。

en: I understand how you feel.
zh: 我理解你的感受。

en: Speak your mind.
zh: 有话直说。

en: I really feel for you.
zh: 我真的很同情你。

en: I know how you feel.
zh: 我知道你的感受。

en: Isn't it a lovely morning?
zh: 今天的早晨真美，不是吗？

en: It was a pleasant day, but there were few people in the park.
zh: 天气挺好的，但公园里没什么人。

en: For somebody who feels rushed all the time, I sure make slow progress.
zh: 对我这个总觉得时间紧的人来说，这进度也太慢了。

en: Your mind is not occupied with your own affairs.
zh: 你没把心思放在自己的事儿上。

en: A strange feeling came over me.
zh: 我突然有一种奇怪的感觉。

en: It's a lovely day.
zh: 今天天气真好。

en: Roll up your sleeves and get busy.
zh: 撸起袖子干活吧。

en: The weather will soon begin to calm down.
zh: 天气快要好转了。

en: I really enjoy the climate.
zh: 我挺喜欢这里的气候的。

en: The climate has much to do with our mind and body.
zh: 气候对我们的身心影响很大。

en: Don't be upset by sudden change of the weather.
zh: 别因为天气突然变了就不高兴。

en: Because of the difference in climate, the same crop is not cultivated in the North and East of the country.
zh: 因为气候不同，这个国家的北方和东方种的庄稼也不一样。

en: The climate affected the growth of trees and plants.
zh: 气候影响了植物的生长。

en: Do you think our climate has an influence on our character?
zh: 你觉得我们的气候会影响性格吗？

en: I can't get over how different the weather is here.
zh: 我真没想到这里的天气跟别处差这么多。

en: Please make yourself at home.
zh: 别客气，当成自己家一样。

en: Take it easy!
zh: 放轻松！

en: Care has made her look ten years older.
zh: 操心让她老了十岁。

en: Care aged him quickly.
zh: 忧虑让他老得很快。

en: Worry affected his health.
zh: 焦虑影响了他的健康。

en: The balloon floated off into the west.
zh: 气球往西边飘走了。

en: A balloon was floating in the air.
zh: 一个气球在天上飘着。

en: The balloon descended slowly.
zh: 气球慢慢降下来了。

en: Take it easy. I can assure you that chances are in your favor.
zh: 别紧张。我向你保证，胜算在你这边。

en: Take it easy. I can assure you that everything will turn out fine.
zh: 别紧张。我向你保证，一切都会好起来的。

en: Take it easy.
zh: 放轻松。

en: Let's take it easy.
zh: 咱们放轻松点。

en: You're happy-go-lucky.
zh: 你真是个乐天派。

en: The temperature has been below freezing for several days.
zh: 气温已经在零度以下好几天了。

en: What's the temperature?
zh: 现在几度？

en: Low temperatures turn water into ice.
zh: 低温会让水结冰。

en: The temperature fell several degrees.
zh: 温度降了好几度。

en: The temperature has suddenly dropped.
zh: 气温突然降下来了。

en: My joints ache when it gets cold.
zh: 天一冷我关节就疼。

en: It's fine to make grandiose plans, but I'd like you to start with what you have on your plate.
zh: 有宏图大志是好事，但我希望你还是先从手头的事做起。

en: I want to get away from the rat race.
zh: 我想逃离这种没完没了的竞争。

en: The barometer is falling. It is going to rain.
zh: 气压在下降。要下雨了。

en: I had enough sense to get out of there.
zh: 我还算聪明，知道赶紧离开那儿。

en: Look out! There's a car coming.
zh: 小心！有车过来了。

en: Look out! There's a hole in the road.
zh: 小心！路上有个坑。

en: She'll get the better of you if you aren't careful.
zh: 你要是不留神，会被她占便宜的。

en: Take care.
zh: 保重。

en: If you're not careful, you might slip and fall on the icy steps.
zh: 你要是不小心，可能会在结冰的台阶上滑倒。

en: I fainted.
zh: 我晕倒了。

en: I pulled myself together and started my work.
zh: 我振作精神，开始干活了。

en: I didn't know you cared!
zh: 我还不知道你这么关心呢！

en: Let your hair down a little.
zh: 别那么拘束，放松点。

en: Relax, and above all, don't panic.
zh: 放松，最重要的是别慌。

en: Take heart and do it again.
zh: 别灰心，再来一次。

en: Watch out, the man has a gun.
zh: 小心，那个人手里有枪。

en: If you're not careful you'll miss a traffic sign!
zh: 你要是不留神，会漏掉交通标志的！

en: I was very careful, but I caught a cold.
zh: 我已经很小心了，可还是感冒了。

en: Watch out! There's a big hole there.
zh: 留神！那儿有个大坑。

en: Beware! There's a car coming!
zh: 当心！有车来了！

en: Take care of yourself, and have a good time!
zh: 照顾好自己，玩得开心点！

en: After an awkward pause, Bill took her by the hand and dragged her upstairs.
zh: 尴尬的沉默之后，比尔拉起她的手，把她拽到了楼上。

en: The weather is fickle.
zh: 这天气说变就变。

en: He is a good fellow, to be sure, but he isn't reliable.
zh: 他人确实不错，就是不太靠谱。

en: Are you crazy?
zh: 你疯了吗？

en: I wish I could think of something to say.
zh: 真希望我能想出点什么该说的话。

en: The pitiful sight moved us to tears.
zh: 那个惨状让我们忍不住落泪。

en: Faint heart never won fair lady.
zh: 胆小鬼追不到漂亮姑娘。

en: It's just your imagination.
zh: 那只是你的错觉。

en: Whether you like it or not, you have to go.
zh: 不管你喜不喜欢，你都得去。

en: Like it?
zh: 喜欢吗？

en: I hope you'll like it.
zh: 希望你会喜欢。

en: You like it, huh?
zh: 你挺喜欢的吧？

en: Please think nothing of it.
zh: 别放在心上。

en: Never mind.
zh: 没关系。

en: Never mind. Anyone can make mistakes.
zh: 没关系，谁都会犯错。

en: Never mind!
zh: 别在意！

en: Caring means being alive.
zh: 有牵挂才算活着。

en: I just brush it off.
zh: 我压根没把它当回事。

en: It's all right.
zh: 没事。

en: Forget it.
zh: 算了吧。

en: I appreciate your concern.
zh: 谢谢你的关心。

en: It's not easy to part with one's favorite possessions.
zh: 很难割舍自己心爱的东西。

en: You've got a good head on your shoulders.
zh: 你这人挺有脑子的。

en: I found myself lying in my bedroom.
zh: 我发现自己躺在卧室里。

en: Please drink the beer before it goes flat.
zh: 趁啤酒还没跑气，快喝了吧。

en: I'm exhausted.
zh: 我累坏了。

en: Turn off the television. I can't concentrate.
zh: 把电视关了吧，我没法专心。

en: You should continue until you're satisfied.
zh: 你应该一直做到自己满意为止。

en: I'm not in the mood.
zh: 我没那个心情。

en: Now that I notice it, I have nowhere to run.
zh: 等我察觉到的时候，已经无路可逃了。

en: It was there, when I noticed it.
zh: 我注意到它的时候，它就在那儿。

en: I found myself back in my room.
zh: 我发现自己回到了房间里。

en: Thank goodness, you've come to.
zh: 谢天谢地，你终于醒了。

en: It took him a moment to realize where he was after he came to.
zh: 他醒了之后过了一会儿才意识到自己在哪里。

en: He was so sad that he almost went mad.
zh: 他伤心得快疯了。

en: I met nobody on my way home.
zh: 我回家的路上没碰到任何人。

en: Could you show me your return ticket?
zh: 能给我看下你的返程票吗？

en: In the car on the way home, he was making plans for the next day.
zh: 在回家的车上，他一直在计划明天的事。

en: I met Naomi on my way home and we had a chat.
zh: 我回家的路上碰到了娜奥米，我俩聊了会儿天。

en: On my way home, I fell asleep on the train and rode past my station.
zh: 回家的路上，我在车上睡着了，坐过站了。

en: I met him on my way home.
zh: 我回家的路上碰到他了。

en: On his way home, Tom met a man who he thought was an American.
zh: 汤姆在回家的路上碰到一个他觉得是美国人的人。

en: I was caught in shower on my way home.
zh: 我回家的路上淋了一场雨。

en: On arriving home, I discovered the burglary.
zh: 一到家，我就发现家里遭贼了。

en: You can go home if you like.
zh: 你想回家的话就可以回。

en: I may have to come home late, in which case I'll telephone you.
zh: 我可能得晚点回家，那样的话我会给你打电话。

en: Returnees have trouble getting used to life in Japan.
zh: 从国外回来的人很难适应日本的生活。

en: I will inquire about the matter after I return home.
zh: 我回家后再去打听一下这件事。

en: Why don't you look in on Mr Anderson on your way back?
zh: 你回来的路上顺便去看看安德森先生怎么样？

en: Be sure to call home before you leave the office.
zh: 离开办公室前一定要往家里打个电话。

en: Please turn out the lights when you leave.
zh: 走的时候请关灯。

en: I'm very sorry I came home so late.
zh: 很抱歉我回家这么晚。

en: You are home late.
zh: 你回来晚了。

en: It is not my intention to return.
zh: 我没打算回来。

en: You're back late. What have you been up to?
zh: 你回来的挺晚的，干嘛去了？

en: Can you find your way home?
zh: 你能认路回家吗？

en: Don't fool around on your way home.
zh: 回家路上别到处乱逛。

en: Don't play around too much after school.
zh: 放学后别玩得太疯。

en: I'm fixing the radio which I found on my way home.
zh: 我在修我在回家路上捡到的收音机。

en: I caught sight of a parade on my way home.
zh: 我回家路上看到游行了。

en: I was caught in a shower on my way home.
zh: 我回家路上淋了一场雨。

en: The trip back was very comfortable.
zh: 回来的路上挺舒服的。

en: Do you have a return ticket to Japan?
zh: 你有去日本的回程票吗？

en: Hopefully you can rest and relax on the flight home.
zh: 希望你在回家的飞机上能好好休息休息。

en: Would you mind picking up something on the way back?
zh: 你回来的时候能不能顺便帮我带个东西？

en: Please drop in at my house on your way home.
zh: 回家路上顺便来我家坐会儿吧。

en: Please drop in on your way home.
zh: 回家路上顺便过来坐坐。

en: It'd be great if you could pick up some bread before you come home.
zh: 你回家前要是能顺便买点面包就好了。

en: I don't wanna go back.
zh: 我不想回去。

en: I'll call by at the post office on the way home.
zh: 我回家路上顺便去趟邮局。

en: Wait here till I come back.
zh: 在这儿等我回来。

en: I will see him after I get back.
zh: 我回来之后去见他。

en: He asked me to wait there until he came back.
zh: 他让我等在那儿直到他回来。

en: She scolded the child for coming home so late.
zh: 她因为孩子回来太晚而训了他一顿。

en: So nice that you are back.
zh: 你回来了真好。

en: On his return he found her daughter asleep.
zh: 他回来时发现女儿睡着了。

en: My bicycle was gone when I returned.
zh: 我回来的时候自行车已经不见了。

en: Get back, get back!
zh: 退后，退后！

en: How many pieces of carry-on are you going to take?
zh: 你打算带几件随身行李？

en: Are there movies on the plane?
zh: 飞机上有电影看吗？

en: Dinner will be served on board the plane.
zh: 飞机上会供应晚餐。

en: His seat in the plane was on the aisle.
zh: 他在飞机上的座位是靠走廊的。

en: The riot police arrived on the scene.
zh: 防暴警察赶到了现场。

en: Wit gives zest to conversation.
zh: 幽默感能让谈话更有趣。

en: The captain will go to the meteorological office to get a weather briefing.
zh: 机长要去气象局了解天气情况。

en: Passengers became nervous when the plane began to vibrate.
zh: 飞机开始震动时乘客们变得很紧张。

en: He is cranky.
zh: 他脾气很臭。

en: The locomotive was pulling a long line of freight cars.
zh: 火车头拉着长长的一串货运车厢。

en: Mechanical power took the place of manual labor.
zh: 机械动力取代了体力劳动。

en: The downtime is caused by a mechanical problem.
zh: 停机是由机械故障引起的。

en: The agonies of the machine age do not originate from the machines as such.
zh: 机器时代的痛苦并非源于机器本身。

en: It is impossible to substitute machines for people themselves.
zh: 机器是不可能完全替代人类的。

en: Press this button to start the machine.
zh: 按这个按钮来启动机器。

en: I got the machine running.
zh: 我把机器发动起来了。

en: The machine squealed for lack of oil.
zh: 机器因为缺油发出了尖锐的响声。

en: Machinery uses a lot of electricity.
zh: 这些机械设备非常费电。

en: Machinery dispenses with much labor.
zh: 机器省去了大量的劳动力。

en: Machinery robs work of creative interest.
zh: 机械化剥夺了工作的创造性乐趣。

en: The machine was clogged with grease.
zh: 机器被油垢堵住了。

en: The machines are idle now.
zh: 这些机器现在都闲置着。

en: You must feed the machine.
zh: 你得给机器喂料。

en: I can do it if you give me a chance.
zh: 如果你给我个机会，我也能行。

en: I seize the moment and turn it to my advantage.
zh: 我会抓住时机，并利用它来为自己创造优势。

en: Don't throw away your chance.
zh: 别浪费了你的机会。

en: You must take advantage of the opportunity.
zh: 你一定要好好利用这次机会。

en: One should always make the most of one's opportunities.
zh: 人总该好好利用身边的每一个机会。

en: Thanks to the opportunity, we were able to avoid substantial effort.
zh: 多亏了这个机会，我们省了不少劲。

en: I'll speak to him at the first opportunity.
zh: 我一有机会就去跟他谈谈。

en: A family should not spend all of its money to keep someone alive on a machine.
zh: 一个家庭不该为了靠机器维持生命而花光所有积蓄。

en: Chance is a nickname for Providence.
zh: “偶然”不过是“天意”的另一种说法。

en: You should see this film if you get the opportunity.
zh: 有机会的话，你应该去看看这部电影。

en: You should change your job if the occasion arises.
zh: 要是有机会，你应该换份工作。

en: I will see him at the first opportunity.
zh: 我一有机会就去见他。

en: I will do it at the first opportunity.
zh: 我一有机会就去做。

en: It's a pity we didn't visit Tom when we had the chance.
zh: 真可惜，我们当时有空没去看看汤姆。

en: The plane rose sharply before leveling off as it left the coast.
zh: 飞机飞离海岸时急剧拉升，然后转为平飞。

en: When the time is ripe, be bold and go for it! I'll stand by you.
zh: 时机成熟了就大胆干吧！我挺你。

en: There were two abstentions.
zh: 有两个人弃权。

en: I was busy with work for the term exam.
zh: 我正忙着复习期末考试呢。

en: The results of the term examination were anything but satisfactory.
zh: 期末考试成绩一点儿都不理想。

en: I have to give myself up to studying for final exams.
zh: 我得全身心地投入到期末考试的复习中去。

en: I've really got to buckle down and study for our final exams.
zh: 我真得静下心来好好复习期末考了。

en: I'm busy because the finals are drawing on.
zh: 因为快期末考了，我挺忙的。

en: Submit your term papers to Professor White.
zh: 把学期论文交给怀特教授。

en: How is your term paper coming along?
zh: 你的学期论文写得怎么样了？

en: He passed the test as was expected.
zh: 他像预想的那样通过了考试。

en: As had been expected, the weather turned out to be very fine.
zh: 果然不出所料，天气非常好。

en: We were filled with joyful expectation.
zh: 我们心里充满了喜悦的期待。

en: Prospect is often better than possession.
zh: 期待往往比拥有更美好。

en: As was expected, he succeeded in winning the prize.
zh: 果然不出所料，他成功获奖了。

en: I'm sure you'll whip us up something really good.
zh: 我相信你会给我们露一手，做顿好吃的。

en: The restaurant was a bummer.
zh: 那家餐厅太让人失望了。

en: As was expected, he won the prize.
zh: 果然，他得奖了。

en: You must get the job done before the deadline.
zh: 你得在截止日期前把工作做完。

en: Let's get an open ticket.
zh: 咱们买张不限日期的票吧。

en: How long do you want it for?
zh: 你想要多长时间的？

en: The known must be separated from the unknown.
zh: 已知的和未知的必须区分开。

en: She knew what it was like for married women to look after houses, husbands and children.
zh: 她知道已婚女性操持家务、照顾丈夫和孩子是什么滋味。

en: Let bygones be bygones.
zh: 过去的就让它过去吧。

en: We tend to welcome only proofs of what we already know.
zh: 我们往往只欢迎那些能证明我们已知观点的证据。

en: Now, the situation is out of hand.
zh: 现在情况已经失控了。

en: I have already done my homework.
zh: 我已经做完作业了。

en: As you already know.
zh: 就像你已经知道的那样。

en: The odds are against me, so I think I'll quit now.
zh: 胜算不大，我想我现在还是退出吧。

en: The flag is up.
zh: 旗子升起来了。

en: Keep sight of the flag.
zh: 别让那面旗子离开你的视线。

en: When I tried to move the desk, one of its legs made a jarring sound as it scraped across the floor.
zh: 我想挪桌子的时候，一条桌腿蹭着地板，发出了刺耳的声音。

en: The desk is covered with dust.
zh: 桌子上全是灰。

en: I hit my funny bone on the edge of the table.
zh: 我的麻筋儿撞到了桌子边缘。

en: The watch on the desk is mine.
zh: 桌上那块表是我的。

en: Let's straighten out the desk.
zh: 咱们把桌子收拾收拾吧。

en: Look at the book on the desk.
zh: 瞧瞧桌子上那本书。

en: Whose is the book on the desk?
zh: 桌上那本书是谁的？

en: Not every book on the desk belongs to me.
zh: 桌上的书不全是我的。

en: The hat on the desk is Chama's.
zh: 桌上那顶帽子是Chama的。

en: He noticed a letter on the desk.
zh: 他注意到桌上有一封信。

en: The dictionary on the desk is mine.
zh: 桌上那本字典是我的。

en: The radio on the desk is a Sony.
zh: 桌上那个收音机是索尼的。

en: The lamp on the desk had an out-of-kilter lampshade.
zh: 桌上那盏台灯的灯罩歪了。

en: The money on the desk is not mine.
zh: 桌上的钱不是我的。

en: A book is lying on the desk.
zh: 桌上放着一本书。

en: I see a book on the desk.
zh: 我看到桌上有一本书。

en: There is a book on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一本书。

en: There is a book on dancing on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一本关于舞蹈的书。

en: There is a map on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一张地图。

en: There is a fan on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一个电风扇。

en: There are some books on the desk.
zh: 桌上有几本书。

en: There is a key on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一把钥匙。

en: I see a flower on the desk.
zh: 我看到桌上有一朵花。

en: What is on the desk?
zh: 桌上有什么？

en: There is an album on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一个相册。

en: There is a card on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一张卡片。

en: There is a dictionary on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一本字典。

en: Was there a book on the desk?
zh: 桌上刚才有书吗？

en: There is an apple on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一个苹果。

en: There is one apple on the desk.
zh: 桌上只有一个苹果。

en: Are there any pens on the desk?
zh: 桌上有笔吗？

en: There are no pens on the desk.
zh: 桌上没有笔。

en: There is a pen on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一支笔。

en: Is there a pen on the desk?
zh: 桌上有一支笔吗？

en: How many pens are there on the desk?
zh: 桌上有几支笔？

en: Fan letters lay in a heap on the desk.
zh: 桌上堆着一堆粉丝来信。

en: The comic books were piled on the desk.
zh: 漫画书在桌上堆着。

en: There wasn't any book on the desk.
zh: 桌上之前没有书。

en: Dust had accumulated on the desk.
zh: 桌上积了一层灰。

en: There is only one book on the desk.
zh: 桌上只有一本书。

en: There is a pair of scissors on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一把剪刀。

en: There are several books on the desk.
zh: 桌上有好几本书。

en: There is a bag on the desk.
zh: 桌上有一个包。

en: The word processor on the desk is my father's.
zh: 桌上那台文字处理器是我父亲的。

en: Look at that picture on the desk.
zh: 看看桌上那张照片。

en: There were no more than two books on the desk.
zh: 桌上顶多也就两本书。

en: There is a cat under the desk.
zh: 桌子底下有一只猫。

en: There is an apple under the desk.
zh: 桌子底下有个苹果。

en: There are not any books under the desk.
zh: 桌子底下没有书。

en: Are there any books under the desk?
zh: 桌子底下有书吗？

en: A cat appeared from under the desk.
zh: 一只猫从桌子底下钻了出来。

en: The desk drawer is open.
zh: 桌子的抽屉开着。

en: I put down a rug under my desk.
zh: 我在桌子底下铺了块地毯。

en: I fell asleep while studying at my desk.
zh: 我在桌子前学习的时候睡着了。

en: I am tied to my desk and chair.
zh: 我整天被拴在办公桌椅前。

en: Desk work is just not my cup of tea.
zh: 坐办公室干活真不是我的菜。

en: I agree with you to a degree.
zh: 我在一定程度上同意你的看法。

en: You can not appreciate the poem until you have read it many times.
zh: 这首诗你得多读几遍才能体会其中的韵味。

en: The treaty has been concluded after many twists and turns.
zh: 经历了重重波折，条约终于签下来了。

en: After having fought many hard battles, we were able to bring home the bacon and set up a new government.
zh: 经过一番苦战，我们终于大获全胜并建立了新政府。

en: Some people kept interrupting the speakers, and finally broke up the meeting.
zh: 有几个人一直在打断发言，最后把会给搅黄了。

en: I'll give you as many as you like.
zh: 你想要多少我就给你多少。

en: Geometry, about which I know nothing, seems like a very dull subject.
zh: 我对几何一窍不通，觉得这门课挺枯燥的。

en: Several newspapers published the story.
zh: 好几家报纸都报道了这件事。

en: You should not give up your hope.
zh: 你不该放弃希望。

en: You must not give up hope.
zh: 你绝对不能放弃希望。

en: Having realized his hope, he returned home.
zh: 实现了愿望后，他就回家了。

en: Don't give up hope.
zh: 别放弃希望。

en: Thoughts of hope, dreams I'll never find.
zh: 那些关于希望的念头，还有我永远无法实现的梦想。

en: Hope is the last thing that man has to flee unto.
zh: 希望是人最后的避难所。

en: I didn't give up for lack of hope.
zh: 我放弃并不是因为没有希望。

en: As long as you have hope, a chance remains.
zh: 只要还有希望，就有机会。

en: The importation of rare wild animals to this country is strictly prohibited.
zh: 这个国家严禁进口稀有野生动物。

en: No one can turn the clock back.
zh: 谁也没法让时光倒流。

en: When you take shelter, make sure you go under a big tree.
zh: 避雨的时候，记得找棵大树底下待着。

en: I was too glad not to jump up.
zh: 我高兴得忍不住跳了起来。

en: What with joy and shame, she blushed to the ears.
zh: 她又是高兴又是羞愧，脸一直红到了耳朵根。

en: To my joy, my daughter passed the examination.
zh: 让我高兴的是，我女儿考试通过了。

en: To her joy, she passed the entrance examination.
zh: 令她欣喜的是，她通过了入学考试。

en: I know you're happy about it. Why don't you just show it?
zh: 我知道你挺开心的，干嘛不表现出来呢？

en: Strange to say, the figure went out of sight suddenly.
zh: 说来也怪，那个身影突然就消失了。

en: It may sound strange, but what she said is true.
zh: 听起来可能有点怪，但她说的是真话。

en: Strange as it may sound, this is true.
zh: 虽然听着挺离谱，但这确实是真的。

en: It may sound strange, but what he said is true.
zh: 听着可能有点奇怪，但他说的确实是真的。

en: It sounds strange, but it is true none the less.
zh: 虽然听起来很奇怪，但它确实是真的。

en: It may sound strange, but it is true.
zh: 听起来可能有点怪，但这是真的。

en: Strangely, the number of students is decreasing each year.
zh: 挺奇怪的，学生人数每年都在减少。

en: Strange to say, he saw the ghost of his father.
zh: 说来也怪，他看见了他父亲的鬼魂。

en: Oddly enough, he insisted on his innocence.
zh: 奇怪的是，他坚称自己是清白的。

en: Strange to say, no one voted for the candidate.
zh: 说来也怪，竟然没人投那个候选人的票。

en: A curious disease struck the town.
zh: 一种奇怪的疾病袭击了这个小镇。

en: A strange fellow, he never speaks unless spoken to.
zh: 他这人挺怪的，没人理他他就不说话。

en: Strange to say, he met someone who was said to be dead.
zh: 说来也怪，他遇到了一个传闻已经去世的人。

en: He's possessed by a strange idea.
zh: 他被一个奇怪的想法给迷住了。

en: There are strange rumors afloat.
zh: 到处都在传一些奇怪的流言。

en: Curiously, a flower bloomed on the withered up tree.
zh: 真奇了，那棵枯树竟然开花了。

en: Curious to say, I didn't find it anywhere.
zh: 说来也怪，我哪儿都找不着它。

en: Strange to say, he didn't know the news.
zh: 说来也怪，他竟然不知道那个消息。

en: Strange to say, the door opened of itself.
zh: 说来也怪，那门竟然自己开了。

en: Strange as it is, the story is true.
zh: 虽然挺奇怪的，但这事儿是真的。

en: Strange things happened on her birthday.
zh: 她生日那天发生了一些怪事。

en: A novel idea occurred to me.
zh: 我突然想到了一个新奇的主意。

en: It's nothing short of a miracle.
zh: 这简直就是个奇迹。

en: He won't be able to escape from there without a miracle, will he?
zh: 除非有奇迹，不然他没法从那儿逃出来吧？

en: Unless there is a miracle, we won't be able to make it on time.
zh: 除非出现奇迹，否则我们赶不上了。

en: Odd numbers alternate with even ones.
zh: 奇数和偶数是交替出现的。

en: The magician had the children's attention.
zh: 魔术师吸引了孩子们的注意力。

en: The magician's tricks surprised us.
zh: 魔术师的戏法让我们吃了一惊。

en: Basically, I agree with your opinion.
zh: 基本上，我同意你的看法。

en: Fundamental instincts will not go away.
zh: 基本的本能是不会消失的。

en: The master plan includes programs to provide employment as well as recreation.
zh: 总体规划包括了提供就业和娱乐的项目。

en: That game is easy, once you learn the basic rules.
zh: 只要你掌握了基本规则，那个游戏就很简单。

en: On base and off, buckle your seat-belts.
zh: 无论是在基地内还是基地外，都要系好安全带。

en: I'm keeping a record of basal body temperature.
zh: 我在记录基础体温。

en: It is important to strengthen the basis.
zh: 巩固基础很重要。

en: It is foolish of you to build a castle in the air while forgetting to drive in pilings for its foundation.
zh: 只顾着建空中楼阁却忘了打地基，你真够傻的。

en: Don't let your feelings show.
zh: 别让你的情绪显露出来。

en: You could tell by the ear-to-ear grin that came to his face that he really had something to smile about.
zh: 看他那合不拢嘴的笑容，就知道他肯定遇到了什么大喜事。

en: I'll be glad to help him.
zh: 我很乐意帮他。

en: I'm willing to help him.
zh: 我愿意帮他。

en: We gladly accept your offer.
zh: 我们很高兴接受你的提议。

en: I'll be happy to answer your question.
zh: 我很乐意回答你的问题。

en: I'm quite agreeable to doing my duty.
zh: 我很乐意尽我的职责。

en: I'll be glad to come.
zh: 我很乐意过来。

en: I will gladly help you.
zh: 我很乐意帮你。

en: I thought you'd jump at the chance.
zh: 我还以为你会急着抓住这个机会呢。

en: I'll do it with pleasure.
zh: 我很乐意效劳。

en: I am glad to accept your invitation.
zh: 我很高兴接受你的邀请。

en: I will be very happy to accept your invitation.
zh: 我会非常高兴地接受你的邀请。

en: I'll be glad to.
zh: 我很乐意。

en: I'll be only too glad to go with you.
zh: 我非常乐意跟你一起去。

en: I will be glad to help you.
zh: 我很乐意帮你。

en: I am ready to go with you.
zh: 我准备好跟你一起去了。

en: I'm glad you enjoyed it.
zh: 我很高兴你喜欢它。

en: I'd be glad to go in your place.
zh: 我很乐意代你去。

en: I'd be happy to attend your party.
zh: 我很乐意参加你的派对。

en: I will be pleased to help you.
zh: 我很乐意帮你的忙。

en: I am only too pleased to come with you.
zh: 我非常乐意跟你一起去。

en: Joy was mingled with sorrow.
zh: 悲喜交加。

en: Short pleasure, long repentance.
zh: 一时的欢愉，长久的悔恨。

en: Tears of joy rained down their cheeks.
zh: 喜悦的泪水顺着他们的脸庞流了下来。

en: Delight is the opposite of sorrow.
zh: 快乐和悲伤是相对的。

en: Waves of joy drift through my opened heart.
zh: 喜悦的浪潮在我敞开的心扉中荡漾。

en: It is easier to sympathize with sorrow than to sympathize with joy.
zh: 同情别人的悲哀比分享别人的快乐更容易。

en: Her face was animated by joy.
zh: 她的脸上洋溢着喜悦。

en: I jumped for joy.
zh: 我高兴得跳了起来。

en: His joy showed on his face.
zh: 他的喜悦都写在脸上了。

en: Sensing danger, he ran away.
zh: 感觉到危险，他撒腿就跑。

en: He stayed behind in view of possible danger.
zh: 考虑到可能有危险，他留了下来。

en: Let's take a chance and go for broke.
zh: 咱们碰碰运气，豁出去干吧。

en: Danger comes soonest when it is despised.
zh: 越是轻视危险，危险就来得越快。

en: He was brave in the face of danger.
zh: 面对危险，他表现得很勇敢。

en: He was still as still in the presence of danger.
zh: 面对危险，他依然镇定自若。

en: When they are in danger, they run away.
zh: 他们一有危险就跑。

en: In a crisis, you must get in touch with your teacher.
zh: 遇到危机时，一定要联系你的老师。

en: The red lamp lights up in case of danger.
zh: 遇有危险，红灯就会亮起。

en: There's a scent of danger.
zh: 有股危险的气息。

en: Dangerous driving should be punished.
zh: 危险驾驶得受罚。

en: Is there any danger?
zh: 有危险吗？

en: He remains calm in the face of danger.
zh: 他面对危险挺淡定的。

en: No idea of danger crossed my mind then.
zh: 那会儿我压根没想到会有危险。

en: The more danger, the more honor.
zh: 越危险，越光荣。

en: This doesn't mean the danger has passed.
zh: 这不代表危险已经解除了。

en: The danger past and God forgotten.
zh: 好了伤疤忘了疼。

en: Dangers give relish to an adventure.
zh: 危险让冒险更有意思。

en: Danger. Keep out!
zh: 危险，别靠近！

en: In a crisis you must keep your head.
zh: 危急时刻得保持冷静。

en: It is essential to keep calm in a time of crisis and avoid going haywire.
zh: 关键时刻得淡定，不能自乱阵脚。

en: I almost missed the train.
zh: 我差点没赶上火车。

en: I was nearly run over by a car.
zh: 我差点被车撞了。

en: If it gets dangerous, give me a call.
zh: 要是有危险就给我打电话。

en: Don't run risks.
zh: 别去冒险。

en: Don't take chances.
zh: 别心存侥幸。

en: The weather is threatening.
zh: 这天看着要变。

en: Look out! There's a truck coming!
zh: 小心！有辆卡车过来了！

en: Look out!
zh: 小心！

en: I came near to being drowned.
zh: 我差点淹死。

en: I was almost run over by a car.
zh: 我差点被车撞了。

en: She wasn't hurt, but she got goose bumps when her car nearly crashed.
zh: 她没受伤，但车差点撞上时，她吓出一身鸡皮疙瘩。

en: I barely missed being struck.
zh: 差一点就撞上了。

en: I had a narrow escape.
zh: 真是死里逃生。

en: It was a close call when the little girl almost drowned in the lake.
zh: 那小姑娘差点在湖里淹死，真是太险了。

en: Corporate bankruptcies continued at a high level last month.
zh: 上个月企业破产数量依然维持在高位。

en: Corporate earnings in the first quarter improved sharply.
zh: 第一季度企业盈利大幅增长。

en: The deterioration of corporate earnings has yet to bottom out.
zh: 企业盈利恶化的趋势还没见底。

en: One problem is how the enterprises arrange posts for excellent female students, but another important point is whether the educational industry can grow and supply creative students needed for Japan's future.
zh: 一个问题是企业如何给优秀的女生安排岗位，另一个关键点是教育行业能不能培养出日本未来需要的创造型学生。

en: Improving corporate performances are behind the stock market recovery.
zh: 股市回升是因为企业业绩好转了。

en: Scott is an entrepreneur with much spirit of enterprise.
zh: 斯科特是个很有进取心的企业家。

en: Companies welcome workers who take initiative.
zh: 公司欢迎积极主动的员工。

en: Corporations are downsizing and reducing the amount of profits they put back into R&D.
zh: 公司都在裁员，还缩减了研发投入。

en: Corporations are competing to fill the vacuum.
zh: 各大公司都在争着填补这块空白。

en: Corporate political donations are coming under heavy scrutiny.
zh: 企业的政治捐款正面临严密审查。

en: Stock prices soared in active trading as corporations announced good financial results.
zh: 随着各公司发布利好财报，交易活跃，股价飙升。

en: Company attorneys are working around the clock to complete the merger.
zh: 公司的律师们正在连轴转忙着完成合并。

en: We soon believe what we desire.
zh: 人总是倾向于相信自己希望的事。

en: If wishes were horses, beggars might ride.
zh: 如果愿望都能成真，那世上就没有穷人了。

en: Make a wish and blow out the candles.
zh: 许个愿，吹蜡烛吧。

en: I hope my dream will come true.
zh: 希望我的梦想能实现。

en: Did you get your wish?
zh: 你的愿望达成了吗？

en: I have spots coming out all over my face.
zh: 我满脸都在起疹子。

en: You look pale. Shall I call the doctor?
zh: 你脸色很苍白，要帮你叫医生吗？

en: He looks pale.
zh: 他脸色不太好。

en: You look pale. What's the matter with you?
zh: 你脸色很难看，怎么回事？

en: You look pale. You'd better take a day off.
zh: 你脸色发白，最好请天假休息下。

en: Billy often hits his face against windows.
zh: 比利经常脸撞在窗户上。

en: You look green.
zh: 你脸色发青，是不是不舒服？

en: Wash your face.
zh: 洗下脸。

en: He told me to wash my face.
zh: 他让我洗个脸。

en: Wipe your face clean.
zh: 把脸擦干净。

en: To lose face means to be humiliated.
zh: 丢脸就是受辱。

en: A shave, please.
zh: 麻烦刮个脸。

en: Turn your face this way.
zh: 脸转到这边来。

en: Looks aside, she is very good-natured.
zh: 撇开长相不谈，她心肠挺好的。

en: Slapped on the face, I didn't fight back.
zh: 被扇了耳光，我没还手。

en: Wash up.
zh: 去洗洗吧。

en: I'm getting little pimples on my face. I wonder if I've been getting enough sleep lately.
zh: 我脸上长痘痘了，不知道是不是最近没睡好。

en: It's hard to tell Englishmen from Americans just by the way they look.
zh: 单看长相，很难分清英国人和美国人。

en: His face went to pieces with tears.
zh: 他哭得脸都皱成一团了。

en: It's an advantage to be good-looking.
zh: 长得好看是个优势。

en: Your face is red.
zh: 你脸红了。

en: My cheeks burn.
zh: 我脸发烫。

en: My face twitches.
zh: 我脸在抽搐。

en: Beauty without goodness is worth nothing.
zh: 徒有美貌而没德行，一点价值都没有。

en: Hang in there, and you can do it.
zh: 坚持住，你能行的。

en: Come on, Shougo. You can do it.
zh: 加油，省吾。你能行的。

en: I try.
zh: 我在努力。

en: I thought our boss was stubborn as a mule but actually he has his cute side.
zh: 我以前觉得老板犟得像头驴，其实他也有可爱的一面。

en: The more stubborn you are, the more isolated you become.
zh: 你越固执，就会变得越孤立。

en: If it becomes stubborn indeed it stands alone.
zh: 固执己见确实会让人形单影只。

en: You must not be stubborn and should be friendly.
zh: 你不能太固执，要友好一点。

en: I've got my stubbornness from my father.
zh: 我这倔脾气是随了我爸。

en: Look out for rock slides.
zh: 小心落石。

en: The fall from the ledge shattered his leg.
zh: 他从岩架上摔下来，腿摔断了。

en: Rocks and minerals are useful for us in many ways.
zh: 岩石和矿物质在很多方面对我们都有用。

en: The rock rolled down the hillside.
zh: 石头顺着山坡滚了下来。

en: Sitting on the rock, she sang a sweet song as she combed her hair.
zh: 她坐在岩石上，边梳头边唱着动听的歌。

en: A small stream ran down among the rocks.
zh: 一股小溪流过岩石间。

en: The rocks are weathered into fantastic forms.
zh: 岩石风化成了千奇百怪的形状。

en: A rock stuck out from the bank into the river.
zh: 岸边的一块岩石伸向河里。

en: I don't exist to you.
zh: 对你来说，我根本不存在。

en: You have to adjust your glasses to your eyes.
zh: 你得调下眼镜来适应眼睛。

en: I've lost my glasses.
zh: 我眼镜丢了。

en: Wearing glasses should correct your vision.
zh: 戴眼镜应该能矫正视力。

en: Without his glasses, he is as blind as a bat.
zh: 他不戴眼镜就跟瞎子一样。

en: Since the bridge looks like a pair of glasses, they call it Meganebashi.
zh: 因为那座桥长得像眼镜，所以大家叫它“眼镜桥”。

en: Survey the landscape below.
zh: 俯瞰下方的景色。

en: The eye may see for the hand, but not for the mind.
zh: 眼睛能指引手，却看不透人心。

en: A person with weak eyes can't see far.
zh: 视力不好的人看不远。

en: The cancer has spread to her stomach.
zh: 癌症已经扩散到她的胃部了。

en: Cancer can be cured if discovered in time.
zh: 癌症发现得早是可以治好的。

en: We have yet to discover an effective remedy for cancer.
zh: 我们还没找到治疗癌症的特效药。

en: Silence grows like cancer.
zh: 沉默像癌症一样蔓延。

en: Can you hear the noise of the waves on the beach?
zh: 你能听到海滩上的浪声吗？

en: I can see some boats far away from the shore.
zh: 我能看到远处海面上的几艘船。

en: I'm getting sick and tired of Ms Maruta and her noisy friends.
zh: 我已经受够了丸田小姐和她那帮吵吵闹闹的朋友。

en: The logs flamed brightly.
zh: 木头烧得很旺。

en: I was exhausted by a full day's teaching.
zh: 教了一整天课，累死我了。

en: I am glad that the matter was settled amicably.
zh: 这事儿能和平解决，我挺高兴的。

en: Is there an information counter?
zh: 请问这儿有问讯处吗？

en: Korean food is generally very spicy.
zh: 韩国菜通常都很辣。

en: Korean food is noted for its spicy flavor.
zh: 韩国菜以辣出名。

en: Korea is now up and coming.
zh: 韩国现在发展得挺快的。

en: What languages do they speak in Korea?
zh: 韩国人都说什么语言？

en: A customs declaration is required.
zh: 需要进行海关申报。

en: Proponents of increased import duties are at odds with each other.
zh: 那些支持提高进口关税的人自己吵起来了。

en: I would like to stress that it is more convenient to control tariffs as a bloc rather than country by country.
zh: 我想强调一下，按贸易集团统一控制关税比按国家逐个控制要方便得多。

en: We hope to lower the tariff.
zh: 我们希望能降低关税。

en: The countries concerned settled the dispute by peaceful means.
zh: 相关国家通过和平方式解决了争端。

en: They found out truth while examining a pile of relevant documents.
zh: 他们在翻看一大堆相关文件时发现了真相。

en: Give me any books you have on the subject.
zh: 把你手头关于这个话题的书都给我。

en: Such an accurate, lightning-quick reply. What can I say?
zh: 回复得又准又快，我还能说什么呢？

en: Social unrest may come about as a result of the endless rising of prices.
zh: 物价不停上涨可能会引起社会动荡。

en: Don't eat between meals.
zh: 别在正餐之间吃零食。

en: Eating between meals is bad for the figure.
zh: 吃零食对身材不好。

en: Eating between meals is a bad habit.
zh: 吃零食是个坏习惯。

en: It is not good to eat between meals.
zh: 吃零食不好。

en: It's a small noisy apartment, but it's where I live and I call it home.
zh: 这公寓虽然又小又吵，但这是我住的地方，就是我的家。

en: We found the failure of the experiment at the last moment.
zh: 我们在最后一刻发现了实验失败的原因。

en: It's as deep as it is wide.
zh: 它有多宽就有多深。

en: The geyser sends up a column of hot water every two hours.
zh: 间歇泉每两小时喷出一股热水。

en: Business recovery, which looks just around the corner, will be rapid and strong.
zh: 经济复苏指日可待，而且势头会非常强劲。

en: He was saved by a hair.
zh: 他差一点点就没命了，好在最后得救了。

en: Seen close-up, things have a way of showing their defects, their innate ugliness.
zh: 离近了看，东西总会露出瑕疵和丑陋的一面。

en: That was a close call.
zh: 好险啊！

en: By mistake I boarded a train going in the opposite direction.
zh: 我坐错车了，坐到了相反的方向。

en: I'm afraid I took your umbrella by mistake.
zh: 我好像拿错伞了，拿成你的了。

en: Correct my spelling if it's wrong.
zh: 要是我拼错了，帮我改一下。

en: It was you that were wrong.
zh: 错的人是你。

en: It is you who is in the wrong.
zh: 是你不对。

en: I'm afraid you got off at the wrong place.
zh: 你好像下错站了。

en: Should we send back the wrong merchandise?
zh: 发错货了，我们要退回去吗？

en: The wrong time, the wrong place.
zh: 时间不对，地点也不对。

en: If you make a mistake, just cross it out neatly.
zh: 要是写错了，就整齐地划掉。

en: I think you have sent me a wrong order.
zh: 我觉得你发错货了。

en: I must have made a mistake.
zh: 我肯定搞错了。

en: Don't laugh at him for making a mistake.
zh: 别因为他犯了错就笑话他。

en: To make mistakes is not always wrong.
zh: 犯错并不总是一件坏事。

en: I entered someone else's room by mistake.
zh: 我走错房间了。

en: I put my gloves on inside out by mistake.
zh: 我把手套戴反了。

en: It was you that made the mistake!
zh: 是你搞错了！

en: You have the wrong number.
zh: 你打错电话了。

en: Correct the errors if there are any.
zh: 要是有错就改过来。

en: Don't be afraid of making mistakes.
zh: 别怕犯错。

en: I'm very sorry about the mistake.
zh: 真抱歉，弄错了。

en: You won't make mistakes.
zh: 你不会出错的。

en: We must concede that we committed an error.
zh: 我们必须承认我们确实犯了错。

en: Correct the mistake and return the file to Mr Luxemburg.
zh: 把错误改一下，然后把文件还给卢森堡先生。

en: It took him only a few minutes to realize his mistakes.
zh: 他只花了几分钟就意识到自己错了。

en: People who are afraid of making mistakes will make no progress in English conversation.
zh: 怕犯错的人练不好英语口语。

en: It's absurd never to admit your mistakes.
zh: 从不认错也太离谱了。

en: To err is human, to forgive divine.
zh: 人非圣贤，孰能无过，宽容才是高尚的。

en: There is no one but commits errors.
zh: 是人都会犯错。

en: Let's take the utmost caution against errors.
zh: 咱们一定要多加小心，千万别出错。

en: Don't worry about making mistakes.
zh: 别担心犯错。

en: Don't make a mistake.
zh: 别搞错了。

en: The number of mistakes is ten at most.
zh: 错的地方最多也就十个。

en: Make sure that you arrive at seven o'clock.
zh: 记得七点准时到。

en: You better believe it.
zh: 那是肯定的。

en: It's a common mistake.
zh: 这种错误很常见。

en: Correct errors, if any.
zh: 有错就改。

en: An error was made.
zh: 出错了。

en: There appears to have been a mistake.
zh: 好像出什么岔子了。

en: You'd better believe.
zh: 你最好相信。

en: Soon the bath was cool enough for him to get into.
zh: 水很快就凉到可以洗澡了。

en: Soon the plane begins to move, and then it takes off.
zh: 飞机很快就开始滑行，然后起飞了。

en: It won't be long before they get married.
zh: 他们很快就要结婚了。

en: The approaching exam, they knew, would be quite easy.
zh: 他们知道接下来的考试会很简单。

en: It was not long before the news came.
zh: 没过多久消息就传过来了。

en: The dry season there will set in soon.
zh: 那里的旱季很快就要开始了。

en: I'm looking forward to seeing you soon.
zh: 我很期待很快能见到你。

en: We are looking forward to seeing you soon.
zh: 我们很期待很快能见到你。

en: Easter will soon come around.
zh: 复活节快到了。

en: I hope it won't be long before I can see you again.
zh: 我希望能快点再见到你。

en: It's going to clear up soon.
zh: 天很快就要放晴了。

en: It will not be long before we meet again.
zh: 我们很快会再见面的。

en: We will soon be ready for the party.
zh: 派对的东西我们马上就能准备好。

en: A hedge between keeps friendship green.
zh: 朋友之间有点距离，友谊才能常青。

en: Let us settle the matter without a third party.
zh: 咱们私下把这事儿解决了吧，别找外人。

en: A fence between makes love more keen.
zh: 保持点距离感，感情才更深。

en: I'm afraid not.
zh: 恐怕不行。

en: I just hope it makes it in time.
zh: 我只希望能赶得上。

en: I didn't think you were going to make it.
zh: 我还以为你赶不上了呢。

en: Walk fast so as to be in time.
zh: 走快点，好赶上时间。

en: To be on time, I ran.
zh: 为了不迟到，我是跑着来的。

en: We're counting on you to wake us up in time, so don't fall asleep.
zh: 我们可全指望你准时叫醒我们了，你千万别睡着。

en: Send me the account.
zh: 把账单发给我。

en: Do you think we can get there in time?
zh: 你觉得我们能赶得上吗？

en: You look very dignified.
zh: 你看起来很有派头。

en: Investigators are trying to pin down the cause of today's fire.
zh: 调查人员正试图查明今天起火的原因。

en: The audience was excited at the game.
zh: 看比赛时，观众们都很兴奋。

en: The crowd may be on the side of Luciano, but the champ has got the skill to win and that's what matters.
zh: 观众可能都支持卢西亚诺，但冠军得靠实力赢，那才是关键。

en: All the audience was excited.
zh: 全场观众都沸腾了。

en: Observation is a passive science, experimentation an active science.
zh: 观察是被动的科学，实验才是主动的。

en: Visiting all the tourist sights really wore me out.
zh: 逛完所有的景点真把我累坏了。

en: The tourists were fascinated with the exquisite scenery.
zh: 游客们都被这精美的景色迷住了。

en: Local shops do good business with tourists.
zh: 当地商店的游客生意做得很好。

en: The tourists wandered around the stores.
zh: 游客们在商店周围闲逛。

en: The tourists painted the whole town red.
zh: 游客们在镇上狂欢了一通。

en: The way tourists dress offends the local standard of propriety.
zh: 游客们的打扮不符合当地的得体标准。

en: The number of tourists has increased greatly in recent years.
zh: 近几年游客人数大幅增加了。

en: Tourists have increased in number.
zh: 游客的人数增加了。

en: Have the tourists all gone on board?
zh: 游客们都上去了吗？

en: Would you give me some travel brochures from your country?
zh: 能给我一些你们国家的旅游手册吗？

en: Where is the tourist information office?
zh: 旅游咨询处在哪里？

en: Please refer to the tourist information office.
zh: 请咨询旅游服务处。

en: The tourist information center gave a city map to whoever asked it.
zh: 旅游咨询中心给每个询问的人都提供一份城市地图。

en: I want to get a sightseeing visa.
zh: 我想办个旅游签证。

en: Tourism is important to the economy of my country.
zh: 旅游业对我国家的经济很重要。

en: The sightseeing bus ran through a long tunnel.
zh: 观光巴士穿过了一个长长的隧道。

en: Is there a tour guide available?
zh: 有导游吗？

en: Tourism generated many new jobs.
zh: 旅游业创造了许多就业机会。

en: It would demoralize the opposing team to give it the razz from the spectators' side.
zh: 观众席上喝倒彩会挫伤对方球队的士气。

en: The audience reacted in different ways to her performance.
zh: 观众对她的表演反应不一。

en: I've staked out places for us in the front row of the auditorium.
zh: 我已经在礼堂第一排给我们占好座了。

en: His home run excited the crowd.
zh: 他的全垒打让全场观众都沸腾了。

en: The audience was carried away by his touching performance.
zh: 观众们被他动人的演出给深深吸引了。

en: The audience appeared bored.
zh: 观众看起来挺无聊的。

en: The audience is really charged up.
zh: 观众的情绪非常高涨。

en: With a scream the spectators scattered.
zh: 随着一声尖叫，观众们四散而逃。

en: The audience sobbed throughout the climax of the movie.
zh: 电影高潮时，观众们一直在抽泣。

en: The audience applauded for a full five minutes.
zh: 观众足足鼓掌了五分钟。

en: The audience applauded the actress.
zh: 观众为女演员鼓掌。

en: The audience was immersed in an aftertaste of the concert.
zh: 观众们仍沉浸在音乐会的回味中。

en: The spectators were moved by her graceful performance.
zh: 观众们被她优雅的表演打动了。

en: It is not what you read but how you read it that counts.
zh: 重要的不是你读什么，而是你怎么读。

en: A new treatment for hepatitis is being studied.
zh: 肝炎的一种新疗法正在研究中。

en: Canned food doesn't interest her.
zh: 她对罐头食品不感兴趣。

en: The can is empty.
zh: 罐子是空的。

en: Check all the loose knots and fasten them tight.
zh: 检查一下所有松动的绳结并把它们系紧。

en: I had no difficulty in finding his office.
zh: 我没费什么劲就找到了他的办公室。

en: That which is easily acquired is easily lost.
zh: 来得容易去得也快。

en: To make a long story short, we married.
zh: 长话短说，我们结婚了。

en: To put it briefly, I do not agree.
zh: 简而言之，我不同意。

en: I'm sure it'll be easy to find a place.
zh: 我敢肯定找个地方很容易。

en: People could have avoided many mistakes by simple experiments.
zh: 人们本可以通过简单的实验避免许多错误。

en: As it is written in simple English, this book is easy to read.
zh: 因为是用简单的英语写的，这本书读起来很容易。

en: It is written in simple English.
zh: 它是用简单的英语写的。

en: It's simple. Just ask anybody.
zh: 很简单，随便问个人就行。

en: Brevity is the soul of wit.
zh: 简洁是智慧的灵魂。

en: Briefly stated, Hobsbawm's thesis is that the history of the twentieth century is that of the decline of civilization.
zh: 简而言之，霍布斯鲍姆的论点是二十世纪的历史就是文明衰落的历史。

en: I need a concise explanation.
zh: 我需要一个简洁的解释。

en: Will you show me how to set up a cot?
zh: 你能教教我怎么搭这种折叠床吗？

en: The orchestra struck up nostalgic music.
zh: 乐队奏起了怀旧的音乐。

en: Water shot from the pipe.
zh: 水从管子里喷了出来。

en: Nurses attend sick people.
zh: 护士照顾病人。

en: The nurse is dressed in white.
zh: 护士穿着一身白。

en: The nurse took his temperature with a thermometer.
zh: 护士用体温计给他量了体温。

en: The nurse looked after the babies.
zh: 护士照顾着那些婴儿。

en: The nurse gave me a shot.
zh: 护士给我打了一针。

en: The nurse soothed the crying child.
zh: 护士在安抚那个哭闹的孩子。

en: The nurse anticipated all his wishes.
zh: 护士对他照顾得无微不至。

en: The nurses must see to the comfort of their patients.
zh: 护士必须确保病人的舒适。

en: The nurse recommended that he try walking.
zh: 护士建议他试着走走看。

en: The nurse told us not to enter the room because the patient was in a critical condition.
zh: 护士告诉我们别进屋，因为病人情况很危险。

en: Please follow the nurse's directions.
zh: 请听从护士的嘱咐。

en: Have you ever thought of becoming a nurse?
zh: 你有没有想过要当护士？

en: The nurses were run off their feet every day.
zh: 护士们每天都忙得脚不沾地。

en: The nurses attend to the patient day and night.
zh: 护士们日以继夜地照顾病人。

en: A nurse wears white.
zh: 护士穿白大褂。

en: The nurse wound my leg with a bandage.
zh: 护士用绷带缠住了我的腿。

en: The nurse took his temperature.
zh: 护士给他量了体温。

en: A nurse took my temperature.
zh: 护士给我量了体温。

en: The nurse will tell you how to do it.
zh: 护士会告诉你该怎么做的。

en: Two nurses are attending her.
zh: 有两个护士在照顾她。

en: The manager sat on the bench with his arms folded.
zh: 经理双手抱胸坐在长凳上。

en: The manager has put him back in the major league.
zh: 经理把他调回了大联盟。

en: The manager bestowed a trophy on him.
zh: 经理颁发给他一座奖杯。

en: The manager sent the bunt sign to the batter.
zh: 经理向击球手发出了短打信号。

en: The manager assembled the players on the field.
zh: 经理把球员们召集到球场上。

en: The manager balanced the strength of his team against that of their opponent and sighed.
zh: 经理对比了自家球队和对手的实力，叹了口气。

en: The director cast me as the devil.
zh: 导演让我演那个魔鬼的角色。

en: In the film, the director makes Hamlet an active person.
zh: 在电影里，导演把哈姆雷特塑造成了一个积极主动的人。

en: The supervisor enforced the rules here in this factory.
zh: 主管在这家工厂里执行了规章制度。

en: You must act under the leadership of your supervisor.
zh: 你必须在主管的领导下开展工作。

en: He left his team as he could not get along with the manager.
zh: 因为跟经理合不来，他离开了球队。

en: Sugar replaced honey as a sweetener.
zh: 糖取代蜂蜜成了甜味剂。

en: You shouldn't expect things to be easy.
zh: 你不该指望事情会很容易。

en: I want something sweet.
zh: 我想吃点甜的。

en: Some are deceived by fair words.
zh: 有些人会被甜言蜜语蒙骗。

en: Do you care for sweets?
zh: 你喜欢吃甜食吗？

en: I can't resist sweet things.
zh: 我对甜食没有抵抗力。

en: Sweet scents are borne on soft breezes.
zh: 微风送来了阵阵清香。

en: Too many sweets cause your teeth to decay.
zh: 甜食吃多了会坏牙。

en: You shouldn't let children eat too many sweets.
zh: 你不该让孩子吃太多的甜食。

en: When it comes to sweets, I just can't control myself.
zh: 一碰到甜食，我就控制不住自己。

en: I'm cutting down on sweets.
zh: 我正在减少甜食的摄入。

en: He's a pushover.
zh: 他这人是个软柿子。

en: Environmental problems call for quick action.
zh: 环境问题需要立即采取行动。

en: The environment was the focus of student council activities.
zh: 环境问题是学生会活动的重点。

en: The destruction of the environment is appalling.
zh: 对环境的破坏程度令人震惊。

en: Environmental pollution is causing abnormal weather conditions.
zh: 环境污染正导致气候异常。

en: Fear of pollution discouraged people from building homes near power plants.
zh: 对污染的担忧让人们不敢在发电厂附近盖房。

en: How to deal with environmental pollution is a serious matter.
zh: 如何处理环境污染是个严肃的问题。

en: Everybody will have to pitch in to save the environment.
zh: 保护环境需要每个人都出一份力。

en: Some factories pollute the environment.
zh: 一些工厂污染环境。

en: We ought to do our best not to pollute our environment.
zh: 我们应该尽力不去污染环境。

en: Environmental changes gave rise to new species.
zh: 环境变化产生了新物种。

en: Teach me some kanji, please.
zh: 教我几个汉字吧。

en: Almost no students get full marks in Chinese classics.
zh: 古文几乎没学生能拿满分。

en: Sweat is dripping from his face.
zh: 他脸上直淌汗。

en: Kanji are difficult to read.
zh: 汉字挺难读的。

en: I felt the sweat trickle down my brow.
zh: 我感觉到汗水从额头流了下来。

en: I'm dripping with sweat.
zh: 我浑身都是汗。

en: The shouting echoes loud.
zh: 喊声震天。

en: We cheered him and chose him as our captain.
zh: 我们为他欢呼，并选他当队长。

en: Shouts of joy burst forth.
zh: 欢呼声四起。

en: The cheers swelled to a roar.
zh: 欢呼声变成了震耳欲聋的呐喊。

en: Familiarity breeds contempt.
zh: 太熟了反而不尊重。

en: I like it better now that I'm used to it.
zh: 习惯了以后我反而更喜欢了。

en: So great was his emotion that he could not utter a word.
zh: 他激动得一句话都说不出来。

en: I was moved to tears.
zh: 我感动得流泪了。

en: Can other people catch it?
zh: 这病会传染给别人吗？

en: I don't want to let my emotions out.
zh: 我不想流露我的感情。

en: The bill was paid in coin.
zh: 账是用硬币结的。

en: Have a nice Thanksgiving!
zh: 感恩节快乐！

en: If we let our reasoning power be overshadowed by our emotions, we would be barking up the wrong tree all the time.
zh: 如果理智被情感蒙蔽了，我们就会一直找错方向。

en: Happy Thanksgiving Day.
zh: 感恩节快乐。

en: I can't think of the right words with which to express my thanks.
zh: 我都不知道该怎么表达我的谢意。

en: I'd like to express my gratitude.
zh: 我想表达一下我的感激之情。

en: I don't know how to express my thanks.
zh: 我不知道该怎么感谢你。

en: May I present this to you in token of my appreciation?
zh: 这是我的一点小小心意，请收下。

en: Even though I felt that there was something strange, I just didn't know what it was.
zh: 虽然我觉得哪儿有点怪，但就是说不上来。

en: The patient was lying in the bed with his eyes closed.
zh: 病人闭着眼躺在床上。

en: The patient was recovering daily.
zh: 病人的身体一天天好起来了。

en: The patient is steadily recovering.
zh: 病人正在稳步康复。

en: The patient was discharged from hospital.
zh: 病人出院了。

en: The doctor emphasized that the patient had only a few days.
zh: 医生强调说病人没几天日子了。

en: The patient got better little by little.
zh: 病人一点点好转了。

en: The patient is out of danger now.
zh: 病人现在脱离危险了。

en: The patient was allowed up.
zh: 病人可以下床走动了。

en: The patient will soon recover from his illness.
zh: 病人很快就会康复的。

en: The patient was quite beyond help, so that the doctors could do no more.
zh: 病人已经没救了，医生也无能为力。

en: Patients often die simply because they yield to their diseases.
zh: 很多病人去世只是因为他们向病魔低头了。

en: The condition of the patient turned for the better.
zh: 病人的病情好转了。

en: The patient's life was in danger.
zh: 病人有生命危险。

en: The patient's condition changes from day to day.
zh: 病人的病情每天都在变。

en: The condition of the patients changes every day.
zh: 病人们的情况每天都在变化。

en: The patient is sick beyond all hope.
zh: 病人已经病入膏肓了。

en: Give medicine to the patient right away.
zh: 赶紧给病人喂药。

en: I cannot say for certain that the patient will recover.
zh: 我不敢保证病人一定能康复。

en: The construction of a highway will contribute to the growth of the suburbs.
zh: 修高速公路会有助于郊区的发展。

en: Dried fish is not to my taste.
zh: 鱼干不合我的口味。

en: If the hay caught fire, it would be a real disaster.
zh: 要是干草着火了，那可真是大灾难。

en: We stored the hay in the barn.
zh: 我们把干草存在谷仓里了。

en: A spontaneous fire started in the hay.
zh: 干草堆里起火自燃了。

en: Try to be generous and forgive.
zh: 尽量大度点，原谅他吧。

en: It's his greatest fault to be too generous.
zh: 他最大的缺点就是人太大方了。

en: Generosity is innate in some people.
zh: 有些人大方是天生的。

en: The bureaucrats maintain solid ties with the gigantic corporations.
zh: 那些官僚和大企业之间关系紧密。

en: Bureaucrats are testing the waters over revising old regulations.
zh: 官员们正试探着修改旧规章的可能性。

en: I have yet to find a perfect husband.
zh: 我还没找到完美的丈夫。

en: Perfection is a trifle dull.
zh: 太完美了反而有点没意思。

en: No problem at all!
zh: 完全没问题！

en: The best is often the enemy of the good.
zh: 追求完美往往会坏了好事。

en: I beat him completely in the debate.
zh: 辩论赛里我彻底赢了他。

en: It seems unlikely that any society could completely dispense with myths.
zh: 似乎没有哪个社会能完全脱离神话。

en: This stone-dead guy had no friends.
zh: 这家伙死得透透的，一个朋友也没有。

en: It cannot be completely cured.
zh: 这病没法根治。

en: Full religious freedom is assured to all people.
zh: 每个人都享有充分的宗教自由。

en: It no longer seems to be a perfect circle.
zh: 看着不像个完美的圆圈了。

en: You have our permission to include our software on condition that you send us a copy of the final product.
zh: 只要你把最终产品发给我们一份，我们就允许你包含我们的软件。

en: My patience has come to the breaking point.
zh: 我的耐心已经到极限了。

en: Fluency in English is a must.
zh: 英语流利是必须的。

en: Give me a break.
zh: 饶了我吧。

en: Please add up the bill.
zh: 麻烦结下账。

en: We'd like separate checks.
zh: 我们分开付。

en: I think there's a mistake in my bill.
zh: 我觉得账单好像算错了。

en: The bill amounted to 100 dollars.
zh: 账单一共是一百美元。

en: May I have the check, please?
zh: 麻烦买单。

en: The bill amounts to fifty dollars.
zh: 账单是五十美元。

en: The bill must be paid today.
zh: 账单今天必须付。

en: I'll foot the bill.
zh: 我来买单。

en: The bill amounts to 500 dollars.
zh: 账单一共五百美元。

en: I paid the bill out of my expense account.
zh: 这笔账我是报销的。

en: Business is business.
zh: 生意归生意。

en: Charge this bill to me.
zh: 记我账上。

en: The bills are all done by computers.
zh: 账单全是电脑出的。

en: The bill amounted to 500 dollars.
zh: 账单一共是五百美元。

en: The bill amounts to five thousand yen.
zh: 账单一共五千日元。

en: The cold wind cut me to the bone.
zh: 冷风刺骨。

en: A cold spell gripped Europe.
zh: 一股寒流席卷了欧洲。

en: A cold wave passed over Japan.
zh: 一股寒潮经过了日本。

en: The thermometer went down below zero.
zh: 温度计降到了零度以下。

en: Thermometers often go below zero.
zh: 温度计经常降到零度以下。

en: I have a chill.
zh: 我有点发冷。

en: I feel cold.
zh: 我觉得冷。

en: I have very bad chills.
zh: 我冷得厉害。

en: Don't you feel cold?
zh: 你不觉得冷吗？

en: Making nothing of the cold, he went out in thin clothes.
zh: 他一点儿也不怕冷，穿得很单薄就出门了。

en: I don't mind the cold, but I can't stand the heat.
zh: 我不怕冷，但我受不了热。

en: The warmth after the chills intoxicated us.
zh: 寒意过后的温暖让我们陶醉。

en: Some plants are quickly affected by cold.
zh: 有些植物很不耐寒。

en: I do feel the cold.
zh: 我确实挺怕冷的。

en: The cold soon penetrated his quilted jacket.
zh: 寒气很快就透过了他的棉袄。

en: I feel cold. Do you mind closing the window?
zh: 我有点冷，你介意关下窗户吗？

en: As the day got cooler, I had to put on a sweater.
zh: 天气变凉了，我得穿件毛衣。
